sentences.english: Some experts say, however, that these would not totally prevent escapes.
sentences.chinese: 然而，一些专家表示，这并不能完全阻止藻类逃逸。

sentences.english: The men fled from the One Way Street bookshop before anyone could catch them.
sentences.chinese: 之后两名男子从单向街书店逃逸。

sentences.english: He said unfortunately one of the attackers managed to escape.
sentences.chinese: 他说，遗憾的是其中一名袭击者设法逃逸。

sentences.english: The witness memorized the license-plate number of the get-away car.
sentences.chinese: 目击者把那辆逃逸的汽车车牌号码记了下来。

sentences.english: In Japan, they appear to have been ruptured by explosions of escaping hydrogen.
sentences.chinese: 在日本，这种安全壳被逃逸的氢气产生的爆炸击碎。

sentences.english: It was first said by a drunk 22-year-old hit-and-run driver.
sentences.chinese: 它最初说的是一个22岁醉酒驾车肇事逃逸的司机。

sentences.english: I was a victim of a hit- and -run accident on Monday.
sentences.chinese: 周一发生了一起肇事逃逸案，我是其中的受害者。

sentences.english: Coronal holes are places in the sun's atmosphere where the magnetic field opens up and allows solar wind to escape.
sentences.chinese: 冕洞是太阳大气层中磁场开放并使太阳风逃逸的地方。

sentences.english: That is the escape velocity that you need.
In this paper, the behaviour of runaway electron is analyzed by experimental method.
sentences.chinese: 本文描述和分析非圆截面环流器中逃逸电子的行为。

sentences.english: I was a victim of a hit-and-run acccident on Monday.
sentences.chinese: 周一发生了一起肇事逃逸案，我是其中的受害者。

sentences.english: We were victims of a hit and run driver.
sentences.chinese: 我们被车撞了，肇事司机逃逸。

sentences.english: The term “hit-and-run” may also be applied to such a driver.
sentences.chinese: 该词也可以指肇事逃逸司机。

sentences.english: The police verified that this car accident was a Hit- and -Run .
sentences.chinese: 警方证实这起车祸是肇事逃逸事件。

sentences.english: I was a victim of a hit-and-run accident on Monday.
sentences.chinese: 周一发生了一起肇事逃逸案，我是其中的受害者。

sentences.english: Tumor can escape from immune surveillance mechanisms of host self through a number of pathways or mechanisms.
sentences.chinese: 肿瘤可以通过多条途径或机制逃逸宿主免疫监视。

definition: to cause an accident/to be responsible for an incident/to provoke a disturbance
to run away/to flee in disarray
to flee from sth/to run away/to escape
to escape without trace (idiom); to make one's getaway (from the scene of a crime)/to show a clean pair of heels
to surrender to the authorities/to turn oneself in (for a crime)
to avoid/to yield (in traffic)/to get out of the way
